requirements.summary: Provide repo-local deployment documentation and helper scripts for reproducible IC deploy + URL retrieval (frontend-side artifacts)
acceptanceCriteria: A root-level deployment document exists (e.g., DEPLOYMENT.md) that explains how to deploy using dfx, including prerequisites, build steps, deploy steps, and how to obtain the live canister URL.
Package scripts (or equivalent documented commands) exist for: building the frontend assets, deploying canisters, and printing the deployed frontend URL.
Following the guide from a clean checkout results in a successful deploy without requiring undocumented manual steps.

file_operations.description: Add a deployment guide section focused on frontend build/release responsibilities: prerequisites, how to build frontend assets, how to run the repo's deploy workflow, and how to retrieve and verify the deployed frontend canister URL; include how to verify the build identifier in the UI after deploy.

Create a repo-local frontend build script that runs the frontend build in a clean/reproducible way and sets/propagates the build identifier environment variable used by the UI (e.g., via VITE_* build-time env).
Create a helper script that prints the deployed frontend URL for the canister hosting the web assets, suitable for copy/paste validation after deployment.
Create a convenience script that chains frontend build + the repo's IC deployment commands (documented), and then prints the deployed frontend URL using the print script.

requirements.summary: Display a build identifier in the UI sourced from build-time configuration and readable in light/dark themes
acceptanceCriteria: The app displays a build identifier (e.g., version/commit/timestamp) in a non-intrusive location (such as the footer area within the MobileShell layout).
The build identifier is set at build time (not hardcoded in the component) so it changes across deployments.
The identifier is readable on mobile and in both light/dark themes.

file_operations.description: Add a small build-info module that reads the build identifier from build-time environment (e.g., import.meta.env) and exposes a safe display string for the UI.

Render a non-intrusive footer area inside MobileShell that displays the build identifier from the shared build-info module; ensure Tailwind classes maintain readability on mobile and in both light/dark themes, and avoid changing immutable paths.

Adjust the existing About section footer attribution layout (currently at the bottom of AboutSection) to avoid duplicated/competing footers now that MobileShell provides a global build identifier footer; keep the attribution while ensuring spacing works with the bottom navigation.
